ReAcT CoNtRoL ChAoS

Demonstration of multiple controls displaying and manipulating the same application state.

Key elements that make this work:

  • React's useReducer hook to manage state in a central location. It's actually nathanbachar's useThunkReducer — highly recommended. Redux and other state management solutions would work fine, too. See components/App.js and reducer.js.
  • Actions that reflect something that happened are named in past tense, and actions that reflect something that should happen are named in the active voice or are thunks (functions). It's important to have a clear conceptual understanding of the difference between the video player saying the volume changed vs. a control setting the volume. See actions.js.
